ground_truth: The brownhead girl smiles, holds out her hand, and places a locket in Flint's huge palm. He clenches his fist around it. A red flashing light spills into the room, and Flint strides over to the window, climbing out onto the fire escape. Emma, Penny's mother, watches him go with a worn, cynical expression. Peter is riding along a quiet street in the dark. He parks outside Aunt May's apartment. Aunt May looks down, her eyes glistening with tears, and sweeps back a lock of her white hair. She takes off her ring. Peter takes the ring and gazes gratefully at his aunt, who smiles back at him warmly. He leans forward, and they hug, holding each other in a warm embrace. After dark, Peter, wearing a dopey smile, rides along a city street. A masked figure in dark green swoops down on a hoverboard and carries him up onto the rooftops. The masked attacker headbutts Peter and clamps a hand across his mouth. Jagged blades spring from his forearms, and he slashes at Peter's stomach. Peter jumps free of the hoverboard and shoots a web thread to the top of a skyscraper. Swinging from the thread, he shoots webbing balls. The attacker ducks to avoid them and slices through Peter's thread. Peter falls, and his dark green mystery attacker smashes him into a wall high above the ground. Stuck in the wall, Peter looks up in a daze as the figure in dark green hovers down towards him and slides his visor back. Peter dodges a huge punch. Harry prises out the section of the wall Peter is clinging to. Peter hangs on as it plummets towards the street below, but Harry swoops down after him, smashing the chunk of wall into fragments. Peter swings away on a thread, but Harry flies at him, thumping him into the air like a ball on elastic. Peter falls. Harry grabs him, dragging and thumping him against the high walls as he flies, then hurling him through a corner of a window. As Peter floats out of the other shattered window, he sees Aunt May's ring spinning through the air in front of him. He then tries to snatch at it. Harry grabs him from behind. Both men balance on the narrow, sweeping hoverboard, the Sky Stick, as they fight. Peter throws Harry off the Sky Stick and fires a couple of web threads, using them to catapult himself down after the falling ring. The Sky Stick automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry. Peter swings down and is just grabbing the ring when Harry strikes him again, sending him sprawling onto a rooftop. Peter opens his fist and looks down at the ring nestled in his palm, then turns and runs as Harry swoops down.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The brunette lass grins, extends out her hand, and sets a pendant in Flint's enormous palm. He grips his fist around it. A crimson blinking light floods into the chamber, and Flint strides over to the window, scaling out onto the fire escape. Emma, Penny's mother, observes him depart with a worn, cynical expression. Peter is riding along a tranquil road in the dimness. He parks outside Aunt May's flat. Aunt May glances down, her eyes shimmering with tears, and sweeps back a strand of her white hair. She removes her ring. Peter takes the ring and gazes appreciatively at his aunt, who beams back at him warmly. He leans forward, and they hug, holding each other in a warm embrace. After dark, Peter, wearing a silly smile, rides along a metropolitan street. A masked character in dark green swoops down on a hoverboard and carries him up onto the rooftops. The masked assailant headbutts Peter and clamps a hand across his mouth. Jagged blades spring from his forearms, and he slashes at Peter's abdomen. Peter leaps free of the hoverboard and shoots a web strand to the top of a skyscraper. Swinging from the strand, he shoots webbing spheres. The assailant ducks to evade them and slices through Peter's strand. Peter falls, and his dark green mystery assailant smashes him into a wall high above the ground. Stuck in the wall, Peter looks up in a stupor as the character in dark green hovers down towards him and slides his visor back. Peter dodges a colossal punch. Harry prises out the section of the wall Peter is clinging to. Peter hangs on as it plummets towards the avenue below, but Harry swoops down after him, smashing the portion of wall into fragments. Peter swings away on a strand, but Harry flies at him, thumping him into the air like a ball on elastic. Peter falls. Harry grabs him, dragging and thumping him against the high walls as he flies, then hurling him through a corner of a window. As Peter floats out of the other shattered window, he sees Aunt May's ring spinning through the air in front of him. He then tries to snatch at it. Harry grabs him from behind. Both men balance on the narrow, sweeping hoverboard, the Sky Stick, as they fight. Peter throws Harry off the Sky Stick and fires a couple of web strands, using them to catapult himself down after the dropping ring. The Sky Stick automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry. Peter swings down and is just seizing the ring when Harry strikes him again, sending him sprawling onto a rooftop. Peter opens his fist and looks down at the ring nestled in his palm, then turns and runs as Harry swoops down.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The brownhead girl smiles, her hand is held out, and a locket is placed in Flint's huge palm by her. The fist is clenched by him around it. A red flashing light spills into the room, and the window is approached by Flint, who climbs out onto the fire escape. Emma, Penny's mother, watches him go with a worn, cynical expression. A quiet street is ridden along by Peter in the dark. The car is parked by him outside Aunt May's apartment. Aunt May looks down, her eyes glistening with tears, and a lock of her white hair is swept back by her. Her ring is taken off by her. The ring is taken by Peter, who gazes gratefully at his aunt, who smiles back at him warmly. He leans forward, and each other is held in a warm embrace as they hug. After dark, Peter, wearing a dopey smile, is riding along a city street. A hoverboard is used by a masked figure in dark green to swoop down and carry him up onto the rooftops. Peter is headbutted by the masked attacker, and a hand is clamped across his mouth. Jagged blades spring from his forearms, and Peter's stomach is slashed at by him. The hoverboard is jumped free of by Peter, and a web thread is shot to the top of a skyscraper. The thread is swung from by Peter, and webbing balls are shot. The attacker ducks to avoid them and slices through Peter's thread. Peter falls, and he is smashed into a wall high above the ground by his dark green mystery attacker. In the wall, Peter looks up in a daze as the figure in dark green hovers down towards him and his visor is slid back. A huge punch is dodged by Peter. Harry prises out the section of the wall Peter clings to. As it plummets towards the street below, Peter hangs on, but Harry swoops down after him, and the chunk of wall is smashed into fragments by him. On a thread, Peter swings away, but at him, Harry flies, thumping him into the air like a ball on elastic. Peter falls. He is grabbed by Harry, who drags and thumps him against the high walls as he flies, then hurls him through a corner of a window. As the other shattered window is floated out of by Peter, Aunt May's ring is seen by him spinning through the air in front of him. He then tries to snatch at it. From behind, he is grabbed by Harry. On the narrow, sweeping hoverboard, the Sky Stick, the men balance as they fight. Harry is thrown off the Sky Stick by Peter, and a couple of web threads are fired by him, using them to catapult himself down after the falling ring. The Sky Stick automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry. Peter swings down and is just grabbing the ring when he is struck again by Harry, sprawling him onto a rooftop. His fist is opened by Peter, who looks down at the ring nestled in his palm, then turns and runs as Harry swoops down.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The brown-haired girl smiles, extends her hand, and places a locket in Flint's large palm. He grips it tightly. A red light flashes, and Flint climbs out the window onto the fire escape. Emma, Penny's mother, watches him leave with a cynical look. Peter rides along a quiet street at night, parking outside Aunt May's apartment. Aunt May, eyes glistening with tears, removes her ring. Peter takes it, gazing gratefully at her, and they share a warm hug. Later, Peter, smiling, rides through the city. A masked figure in dark green swoops down on a hoverboard, carrying him to the rooftops. The attacker headbutts Peter, clamps his mouth, and slashes at him with forearm blades. Peter jumps free, shooting a web to a skyscraper and swinging while firing web balls. The attacker dodges and cuts Peter's thread, causing him to fall. The attacker smashes Peter into a wall, then hovers down, sliding his visor back. Peter dodges a punch as Harry pries out the wall section Peter clings to. Peter hangs on as it falls, but Harry smashes it into fragments. Peter swings away, but Harry thumps him into the air, dragging and hurling him through a window. As Peter floats out, he sees Aunt May's ring spinning and tries to grab it. Harry grabs him from behind. They balance on the hoverboard, the Sky Stick, fighting. Peter throws Harry off and uses web threads to catapult after the ring. The Sky Stick collects Harry. Peter grabs the ring, but Harry strikes him, sending him sprawling onto a rooftop. Peter opens his fist, sees the ring, and runs as Harry swoops down.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The brown-haired girl smiles, hands a locket to Flint, who clenches it. A red light fills the room as Flint exits onto the fire escape. Emma, Penny's mother, watches cynically. Peter rides a quiet street, parks at Aunt May's. She, teary-eyed, removes her ring. Peter gratefully takes it, and they hug warmly. Later, Peter rides with a dopey smile. A masked figure on a hoverboard grabs him, headbutts him, and slashes at his stomach. Peter escapes, swings from a skyscraper, and shoots web balls. The attacker dodges, cuts Peter's thread, and smashes him into a wall. Dazed, Peter dodges a punch as Harry pries him from the wall. Peter clings to the falling wall, but Harry shatters it. Peter swings away, but Harry attacks, hurling him through a window. As Peter floats out, he sees Aunt May's ring and tries to grab it. Harry grabs him, and they fight on the Sky Stick. Peter throws Harry off, catapults after the ring, and the Sky Stick retrieves Harry. Peter grabs the ring, but Harry strikes him onto a rooftop. Peter opens his fist, sees the ring, and runs as Harry swoops down.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The girl with brown hair beams a bright smile, extending her hand gracefully to place a delicate locket into Flint's large, open palm. Flint, with a determined expression, closes his fist tightly around the locket. Suddenly, a red flashing light floods the room with an urgent glow, prompting Flint to stride purposefully over to the window. He climbs out onto the fire escape with swift, practiced movements. Emma, who is Penny's mother, observes his departure with a weary, cynical look etched on her face. Meanwhile, Peter is riding his bike along a quiet, dimly lit street under the cover of darkness. He comes to a stop outside Aunt May's apartment building. Aunt May, with tears glistening in her eyes, looks down and gently sweeps back a stray lock of her white hair. She removes her ring with a sense of solemnity. Peter accepts the ring, gazing at his aunt with deep gratitude, and she returns his gaze with a warm, affectionate smile. Leaning forward, they share a heartfelt hug, holding each other in a comforting embrace. Later, after nightfall, Peter, wearing a somewhat goofy smile, rides along a bustling city street. Suddenly, a masked figure clad in dark green swoops down on a hoverboard, lifting him up onto the rooftops. The masked assailant headbutts Peter and clamps a firm hand over his mouth. Sharp, jagged blades extend from the attacker's forearms, and he slashes menacingly at Peter's stomach. Peter manages to leap free of the hoverboard, shooting a web thread to the top of a towering skyscraper. As he swings from the thread, he fires webbing balls at his attacker. The attacker skillfully ducks to avoid them and slices through Peter's thread with precision. Peter plummets, and his mysterious attacker in dark green smashes him into a wall high above the ground. Stuck in the wall, Peter looks up in a daze as the figure in dark green hovers down towards him, sliding his visor back. Peter narrowly dodges a massive punch. Harry, revealing himself, pries out the section of the wall to which Peter clings. Peter desperately hangs on as it plummets towards the street below, but Harry swoops down after him, shattering the chunk of wall into fragments. Peter swings away on a thread, but Harry relentlessly flies at him, thumping him into the air like a ball on elastic. Peter falls, and Harry seizes him, dragging and thumping him against the high walls as he flies, then hurling him through a corner of a window. As Peter floats out of the other shattered window, he catches sight of Aunt May's ring spinning through the air in front of him. He reaches out, trying to snatch it. Harry grabs him from behind. Both men balance precariously on the narrow, sweeping hoverboard, known as the Sky Stick, as they engage in a fierce battle. Peter manages to throw Harry off the Sky Stick and fires a couple of web threads, using them to catapult himself down after the falling ring. The Sky Stick automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry. Peter swings down and is just about to grab the ring when Harry strikes him again, sending him sprawling onto a nearby rooftop. Peter opens his fist and looks down at the ring nestled securely in his palm, then turns and runs as Harry swoops down once more.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
The young girl, her brown hair cascading down her shoulders, beams with a radiant and welcoming smile as she gracefully extends her delicate hand. Gently and carefully, she places a fragile locket into Flint's large, open palm, which eagerly awaits the precious object. Flint, harboring a determined and resolute expression on his face, closes his fist tightly around the locket, as though securing a treasure. Suddenly, the room is awash in an urgent and intense red flashing light, flooding the space with a sense of immediacy and alarm, prompting Flint to stride purposefully over to the nearby window. With rapid, swift, and well-practiced movements, he climbs out onto the fire escape. Observing his departure, Emma, who is Penny's mother, watches him with a weary and cynical expression etched deeply on her face. 

Meanwhile, Peter is riding his bike along a quiet and dimly lit street, shrouded under the cover of darkness. He eventually comes to a stop outside Aunt May's apartment building. Aunt May stands there, with tears glistening like tiny crystals in her eyes. She looks down, gently sweeping back a stray lock of her white hair with a delicate motion. Removing her ring with a solemn and grave sense of duty, she extends it to Peter. He accepts the ring, looking at his aunt with deep gratitude in his eyes, and she returns his gaze with a warm and affectionate smile. Leaning forward, they share a heartfelt and tender hug, holding each other in a comforting embrace that speaks volumes of their bond.

Later, after nightfall has fully descended, Peter, wearing a somewhat goofy yet endearing smile, rides along a bustling and lively city street. Suddenly, a masked figure clad in dark green makes a swift descent on a hoverboard, lifting Peter up onto the rooftops. The masked assailant aggressively headbutts Peter and clamps a firm, unyielding hand over his mouth. Sharp and jagged blades emerge menacingly from the attacker's forearms, and he slashes threateningly at Peter's stomach. Peter manages to leap free of the hoverboard, expertly shooting a web thread to the top of a towering skyscraper. As he swings from the thread, he fires webbing balls at his attacker. Demonstrating agility, the attacker skillfully ducks to avoid them and slices through Peter's thread with precision. 

Peter plummets through the air, and his mysterious assailant dressed in dark green smashes him into a wall high above the ground. Stuck in the wall, Peter looks up in a daze as the figure in dark green hovers near him, sliding back his visor. Peter narrowly avoids a massive punch. Harry, revealing himself, pries out the section of the wall to which Peter clings, forcing Peter to desperately hold on as it plummets toward the street below. However, Harry swoops down after him, shattering the chunk of wall into fragments. Peter swings away on a thread, but Harry relentlessly pursues him, thumping him into the air like a ball on elastic. Peter falls, and Harry seizes him again, dragging and thumping him against the high walls as he flies, then hurling him violently through a corner of a window.

As Peter floats out of the other shattered window, he catches sight of Aunt May's cherished ring spinning gracefully through the air in front of him. He reaches out, stretching his hand to snatch it. Just then, Harry grabs him from behind. Both men balance precariously on the narrow and sweeping hoverboard, known as the Sky Stick, as they engage in a fierce and intense battle. Peter skillfully manages to throw Harry off the Sky Stick and fires a couple of web threads, using them to catapult himself downward after the falling ring. The Sky Stick automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry. Peter swings down and is just about to grab the ring when Harry strikes him once more, sending him sprawling onto a nearby rooftop. Opening his fist, Peter looks down at the ring nestled securely in his palm, then turns and runs as Harry swoops down yet again.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The brown-haired girl, with a gentle smile on her face, extends her hand slowly and carefully places a delicate locket into Flint's large, open palm. Flint, feeling the weight of the locket, closes his fingers tightly around it, forming a fist. Suddenly, a red flashing light floods the room, casting an urgent glow on the surroundings. Reacting quickly, Flint strides purposefully towards the window, his movements confident and determined, before climbing out onto the fire escape with practiced ease. Inside, Emma, who is Penny's mother, stands watching him leave, her face etched with a worn, cynical expression that speaks volumes of her experiences. Meanwhile, Peter is riding his bike along a quiet street enveloped in darkness, the only sound being the gentle hum of his wheels on the pavement. He comes to a stop outside Aunt May's apartment, parking his bike with care. Inside, Aunt May looks down, her eyes shimmering with unshed tears, and gently sweeps back a stray lock of her white hair, a gesture filled with emotion. With a heavy heart, she removes her ring, handing it to Peter, who accepts it with a gaze full of gratitude directed at his aunt. She responds with a warm, reassuring smile. Peter leans forward, and they share a heartfelt hug, holding each other in a comforting embrace that speaks of their deep bond. Later, after night has fallen, Peter, now wearing a dopey smile, rides his bike along a city street, the lights casting a soft glow around him. Suddenly, a masked figure dressed in dark green swoops down from above on a hoverboard, lifting Peter up onto the rooftops with a swift, unexpected motion. The masked attacker, with a swift and brutal movement, headbutts Peter and clamps a hand firmly across his mouth. From the attacker's forearms, jagged blades spring forth, and he slashes at Peter's stomach with a vicious swipe. Reacting quickly, Peter jumps free of the hoverboard, shooting a web thread towards the top of a nearby skyscraper. As he swings from the thread, he rapidly shoots webbing balls at his attacker. The attacker, agile and quick, ducks to avoid them and slices through Peter's thread with precision. Peter plummets, and the dark green mystery attacker smashes him into a wall high above the ground. Stuck in the wall, Peter looks up, dazed and disoriented, as the figure in dark green hovers down towards him, sliding his visor back with a menacing intent. Peter, regaining his senses, dodges a massive punch aimed at him. Harry, now revealed, prises out the section of the wall Peter is clinging to, causing Peter to hang on desperately as it plummets towards the street below. Harry swoops down after him, smashing the chunk of wall into fragments with a powerful blow. Peter swings away on a thread, but Harry, relentless in his pursuit, flies at him, thumping him into the air like a ball on elastic. Peter falls, and Harry grabs him, dragging and thumping him against the high walls as he flies, then hurling him through a corner of a window with a forceful throw. As Peter floats out of the other shattered window, he catches sight of Aunt May's ring spinning through the air in front of him, a glinting reminder of his mission. He reaches out, trying to snatch it from the air. Harry, however, grabs him from behind, and both men find themselves balancing precariously on the narrow, sweeping hoverboard known as the Sky Stick as they continue their fierce fight. In a swift move, Peter throws Harry off the Sky Stick and fires a couple of web threads, using them to catapult himself down after the falling ring. The Sky Stick, programmed to respond, automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry. Peter swings down, his focus solely on the ring, and just as he is about to grab it, Harry strikes him again, sending him sprawling onto a rooftop. Peter opens his fist, looking down at the ring nestled safely in his palm, a small victory amidst the chaos, then turns and runs as Harry swoops down once more, the chase continuing.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The brown-haired girl smiles and places a locket in Flint's palm, which he clenches tightly. As a red flashing light fills the room, Flint strides to the window and climbs onto the fire escape, leaving Emma, Penny's mother, watching with a cynical expression. Meanwhile, Peter rides quietly through the dark streets and parks outside Aunt May's apartment. With tears in her eyes, Aunt May removes her ring and hands it to Peter, who gazes at her gratefully before they share a warm embrace. Later, Peter, wearing a dopey smile, rides through the city when a masked figure on a hoverboard swoops down, carrying him to the rooftops. The attacker headbutts Peter, clamps a hand over his mouth, and slashes at him with forearm blades. Peter escapes the hoverboard, shoots a web to a skyscraper, and swings while firing web balls. The attacker dodges, slices Peter's thread, and smashes him into a wall. Dazed, Peter watches as the figure hovers closer and slides back his visor. Peter dodges a punch, but Harry pries the wall section loose, sending Peter plummeting. Harry smashes the wall into fragments, but Peter swings away, only to be thumped into the air by Harry. As Peter falls, Harry drags and hurls him through a window. Floating out the other side, Peter sees Aunt May's ring spinning and tries to grab it, but Harry grabs him from behind. They balance on the Sky Stick, fighting until Peter throws Harry off and uses web threads to catapult himself after the ring. The Sky Stick retrieves Harry as Peter grabs the ring, but Harry strikes again, sending Peter sprawling onto a rooftop. Peter opens his fist to see the ring nestled in his palm, then turns and runs as Harry swoops down.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The brownhead girl smiles, holds out her hand, and places a locket in Flint's huge palm. The locket, an heirloom from the 19th century known for its intricate engravings, holds sentimental value. He clenches his fist around it. A red flashing light, part of the emergency alarm system common in high-rise apartments, spills into the room, and Flint strides over to the window, climbing out onto the fire escape, a metal staircase attached to many city buildings for urgent evacuation. Emma, Penny's mother, watches him go with a worn, cynical expression that reflects years of personal hardships. Peter is riding along a quiet, suburban street in the dark. He parks outside Aunt May's apartment, a modest building known for its charming historical architecture. Aunt May looks down, her eyes glistening with tears, and sweeps back a lock of her white hair. She takes off her ring, a beloved keepsake from her late husband. Peter takes the ring and gazes gratefully at his aunt, who smiles back at him warmly with the love that has always been his guiding light. He leans forward, and they hug, holding each other in a warm embrace filled with unspoken understanding. After dark, Peter, wearing a dopey smile as if lost in happy memories, rides along a city street. A masked figure in dark green, whose identity is shrouded in mystery, swoops down on a hoverboard, a futuristic device called the Sky Stick, and carries him up onto the rooftops. The masked attacker, known for his ruthless tactics, headbutts Peter and clamps a hand across his mouth. Jagged blades, a deadly modification, spring from his forearms, and he slashes at Peter's stomach. Peter jumps free of the hoverboard and shoots a web thread to the top of a skyscraper. Swinging from the thread, he shoots webbing balls, a skill perfected through countless hours of practice. The attacker ducks to avoid them and slices through Peter's thread, severing his only support. Peter falls, and his dark green mystery attacker smashes him into a wall high above the ground. Stuck in the wall, Peter looks up in a daze as the figure in dark green hovers down towards him and slides his visor back, revealing a known adversary. Peter dodges a huge punch. Harry, a once-close friend turned foe, prises out the section of the wall Peter is clinging to. Peter hangs on as it plummets towards the street below, but Harry swoops down after him, smashing the chunk of wall into fragments, increasing the danger. Peter swings away on a thread, but Harry flies at him, thumping him into the air like a ball on elastic, a display of his superior physical prowess. Peter falls. Harry grabs him, dragging and thumping him against the high walls as he flies, then hurling him through a corner of a window, one of the few remaining intact. As Peter floats out of the other shattered window, he sees Aunt May's ring spinning through the air in front of him, a symbol of familial love and duty. He then tries to snatch at it. Harry grabs him from behind. Both men balance on the narrow, sweeping hoverboard, the Sky Stick, as they fight, their skilled maneuvers reflecting their long history of conflict and betrayal. Peter throws Harry off the Sky Stick and fires a couple of web threads, using them to catapult himself down after the falling ring, an act driven by deeper emotions than the fight itself. The Sky Stick automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry, a failsafe he had installed for moments like these. Peter swings down and is just grabbing the ring when Harry strikes him again, sending him sprawling onto a rooftop, disoriented but determined. Peter opens his fist and looks down at the ring nestled in his palm, then turns and runs as Harry swoops down, their battle far from over.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: The brownhead girl smiles holds out her hand and places a locket in Flint's huge palm. He clenches his fist around it. A red flashing light spills into the room and Flint strides over to the window climbing out onto the fire escape. Emma Penny's mother watches him go with a worn cynical expression. Peter is riding along a quiet street in the dark. He parks outside Aunt May's apartment. Aunt May looks down her eyes glistening with tears and sweeps back a lock of her white hair. She takes off her ring. Peter takes the ring and gazes gratefully at his aunt who smiles back at him warmly. He leans forward and they hug holding each other in a warm embrace. After dark Peter wearing a dopey smile rides along a city street. A masked figure in dark green swoops down on a hoverboard and carries him up onto the rooftops. The masked attacker headbutts Peter and clamps a hand across his mouth. Jagged blades spring from his forearms and he slashes at Peter's stomach. Peter jumps free of the hoverboard and shoots a web thread to the top of a skyscraper. Swinging from the thread he shoots webbing balls. The attacker ducks to avoid them and slices through Peter's thread. Peter falls and his dark green mystery attacker smashes him into a wall high above the ground. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. Stuck in the wall. Peter looks up in a daze as the figure in dark green hovers down towards him and slides his visor back. Peter dodges a huge punch. Harry prises out the section of the wall. Peter is clinging to. Peter hangs on as it plummets towards the street below but Harry swoops down after him smashing the chunk of wall into fragments. Peter swings away on a thread but Harry flies at him thumping him into the air like a ball on elastic. Peter falls. Harry grabs him dragging and thumping him against the high walls as he flies then hurling him through a corner of a window. As Peter floats out of the other shattered window he sees Aunt May's ring spinning through the air in front of him. He then tries to snatch at it. Harry grabs him from behind. Both men balance on the narrow sweeping hoverboard. the Sky Stick as they fight. Peter throws Harry off the Sky Stick and fires a couple of web threads using them to catapult himself down after the falling ring. The Sky Stick automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry. Peter swings down and is just grabbing the ring when Harry strikes him again sending him sprawling onto a rooftop. Peter opens his fist and looks down at the ring nestled in his palm then turns and runs as Harry swoops down.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The brownhead girl smiles holds out her hand and places a locket in Flint's huge palm. He clenches his fist around it. A red flashing light spills into the room and Flint strides over to the window climbing out onto the fire escape. Emma Penny's mother watches him go with a worn cynical expression. Peter is riding along a quiet street in the dark. He parks outside Aunt May's apartment. Aunt May looks down her eyes glistening with tears and sweeps back a lock of her white hair. She takes off her ring. Peter takes the ring and gazes gratefully at his aunt who smiles back at him warmly. He leans forward and they hug holding each other in a warm embrace. After dark Peter wearing a dopey smile rides along a city street. A masked figure in dark green swoops down on a hoverboard and carries him up onto the rooftops. The masked attacker headbutts Peter and clamps a hand across his mouth. Jagged blades spring from his forearms and he slashes at Peter's stomach. Peter jumps free of the hoverboard and shoots a web thread to the top of a skyscraper. Swinging from the thread he shoots webbing balls. The attacker ducks to avoid them and slices through Peter's thread. Peter falls and his dark green mystery attacker smashes him into a wall high above the ground. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: The brownhead girl smiles holds out her hand and places a locket in Flint's huge palm. He clenches his fist around it. A red flashing light spills into the room and Flint strides over to the window climbing out onto the fire escape. Emma Penny's mother watches him go with a worn cynical expression. Peter throws Harry off the Sky Stick and fires a couple of web threads using them to catapult himself down after the falling ring. The Sky Stick automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry. Peter swings down and is just grabbing the ring when Harry strikes him again sending him sprawling onto a rooftop. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The squirrel smiles, holds out its hand, and places a locket in the elephant's huge palm. The elephant clenches its fist around it. A red flashing light spills into the room, and the elephant strides over to the window, climbing out onto the fire escape. The rabbit, the fox's mother, watches the elephant go with a worn, cynical expression. The turtle is riding along a quiet street in the dark. It parks outside the owl's apartment. The owl looks down, its eyes glistening with tears, and sweeps back a lock of its white hair. It takes off its ring. The turtle takes the ring and gazes gratefully at the owl, who smiles back at it warmly. The turtle leans forward, and they hug, holding each other in a warm embrace. After dark, the turtle, wearing a dopey smile, rides along a city street. A masked figure in dark green swoops down on a hoverboard and carries the turtle up onto the rooftops. The masked attacker headbutts the turtle and clamps a hand across its mouth. Jagged blades spring from the attacker's forearms, and the attacker slashes at the turtle's stomach. The turtle jumps free of the hoverboard and shoots a web thread to the top of a skyscraper. Swinging from the thread, it shoots webbing balls. The attacker ducks to avoid them and slices through the turtle's thread. The turtle falls, and its dark green mystery attacker smashes it into a wall high above the ground. Stuck in the wall, the turtle looks up in a daze as the figure in dark green hovers down towards it and slides its visor back. The turtle dodges a huge punch. The cat prises out the section of the wall the turtle is clinging to. The turtle hangs on as it plummets towards the street below, but the cat swoops down after it, smashing the chunk of wall into fragments. The turtle swings away on a thread, but the cat flies at it, thumping it into the air like a ball on elastic. The turtle falls. The cat grabs it, dragging and thumping it against the high walls as it flies, then hurling it through a corner of a window. As the turtle floats out of the other shattered window, it sees the owl's ring spinning through the air in front of it. It then tries to snatch at it. The cat grabs it from behind. Both creatures balance on the narrow, sweeping hoverboard, the Sky Stick, as they fight. The turtle throws the cat off the Sky Stick and fires a couple of web threads, using them to catapult itself down after the falling ring. The Sky Stick automatically zooms down to collect the falling cat. The turtle swings down and is just grabbing the ring when the cat strikes it again, sending it sprawling onto a rooftop. The turtle opens its fist and looks down at the ring nestled in its palm, then turns and runs as the cat swoops down.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The brownhead girl smiles, holds out her hand, and places a bracelet in Flint's huge palm. He clenches his fist around it. A blue flickering flame spills into the room, and Flint strides over to the door, climbing out onto the balcony. Emma, Penny's mother, watches him go with a worn, cynical expression. Peter is riding along a deserted avenue in the dark. He parks outside Aunt May's bakery. Aunt May looks down, her eyes glistening with tears, and sweeps back a lock of her silver hair. She takes off her necklace. Peter takes the necklace and gazes gratefully at his aunt, who smiles back at him warmly. He leans forward, and they hug, holding each other in a warm embrace. After dark, Peter, wearing a dopey smile, rides along a suburban lane. A masked figure in dark blue swoops down on a glider and carries him up onto the rooftops. The masked attacker headbutts Peter and clamps a hand across his mouth. Sharp spikes spring from his shoulders, and he slashes at Peter's chest. Peter jumps free of the glider and shoots a rope vine to the top of a tower. Swinging from the vine, he shoots webbing balls. The attacker ducks to avoid them and slices through Peter's vine. Peter falls, and his dark blue mystery attacker smashes him into a wall high above the ground. Stuck in the wall, Peter looks up in a daze as the figure in dark blue hovers down towards him and slides his helmet back. Peter dodges a huge punch. Harry prises out the section of the wall Peter is clinging to. Peter hangs on as it plummets towards the street below, but Harry swoops down after him, smashing the chunk of wall into fragments. Peter swings away on a vine, but Harry flies at him, thumping him into the air like a ball on elastic. Peter falls. Harry grabs him, dragging and thumping him against the high walls as he flies, then hurling him through a corner of a door. As Peter floats out of the other shattered door, he sees Aunt May's necklace spinning through the air in front of him. He then tries to snatch at it. Harry grabs him from behind. Both men balance on the narrow, sweeping glider, the Sky Glider, as they fight. Peter throws Harry off the Sky Glider and fires a couple of rope vines, using them to catapult himself down after the falling necklace. The Sky Glider automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry. Peter swings down and is just grabbing the necklace when Harry strikes him again, sending him sprawling onto a rooftop. Peter opens his fist and looks down at the necklace nestled in his palm, then turns and runs as Harry swoops down.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The brownhead girl grins, waves her hand, and drops a locket in Flint's huge palm. He tosses it casually in his hand. A red flashing light illuminates the room, and Flint ambles over to the window, tumbling out onto the fire escape. Emma, Penny's mother, observes him go with a detached, skeptical expression. Peter is cruising along a quiet street in the dark. He stops outside Aunt May's apartment. Aunt May glances down, her eyes shimmering with tears, and tucks back a lock of her white hair. She removes her ring. Peter accepts the ring and stares gratefully at his aunt, who beams back at him warmly. He leans forward, and they hold hands, holding each other in a warm embrace. After dark, Peter, wearing a silly grin, coasts along a city street. A masked figure in dark green dives down on a hoverboard and lifts him up onto the rooftops. The masked attacker punches Peter and clamps a hand over his mouth. Jagged blades extend from his forearms, and he lunges at Peter's stomach. Peter leaps from the hoverboard and launches a web thread to the top of a skyscraper. Swinging from the thread, he fires webbing balls. The attacker dodges to sidestep them and cuts through Peter's thread. Peter plummets, and his dark green mystery attacker crashes him into a wall high above the ground. Lodged in the wall, Peter glances up in confusion as the figure in dark green glides down towards him and flips his visor up. Peter evades a huge punch. Harry extracts the section of the wall Peter is clinging to. Peter clutches on as it descends towards the street below, but Harry dives down after him, shattering the chunk of wall into fragments. Peter swings away on a thread, but Harry charges at him, propelling him into the air like a ball on elastic. Peter descends. Harry snatches him, dragging and jostling him against the high walls as he flies, then flinging him through a corner of a window. As Peter floats out of the other shattered window, he notices Aunt May's ring spiraling through the air in front of him. He then attempts to grab it. Harry seizes him from behind. Both men balance on the narrow, sweeping hoverboard, the Sky Stick, as they scuffle. Peter shoves Harry off the Sky Stick and shoots a couple of web threads, using them to sling himself down after the falling ring. The Sky Stick automatically darts down to retrieve the falling Harry. Peter swings down and is just clasping the ring when Harry strikes him again, sending him tumbling onto a rooftop. Peter opens his fist and gazes down at the ring nestled in his palm, then turns and dashes as Harry swoops down.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The sunflower boy frowns, holds out his paw, and places a whistle in Luna's tiny hoof. She unclenches her claw around it. A blue shimmering shadow spills into the cave, and Luna crawls over to the door, climbing out onto the mountain ledge. Oliver, Lily's brother, watches her leave with a bright, joyful expression. Sarah is floating along a noisy tunnel in the light. She stops inside Uncle Joe's cottage. Uncle Joe looks up, his nose glistening with laughter, and flips back a curl of his green fur. He puts on his bracelet. Sarah hands the bracelet and blinks sadly at her uncle, who dances back at her coldly. She leaps backward, and they cheer, chasing each other in a cold race. After light, Sarah, wearing a sleepy frown, floats along a country river. A smiling creature in light blue hovers up on a unicycle and places her down beneath the bridges. The smiling friend kneekicks Sarah and cradles a shoe across her ear. Smooth circles spring from her ankles, and she punches at Sarah's knee. Sarah floats trapped on the unicycle and blows a wind thread to the bottom of a valley. Crawling from the thread, she blows wind balls. The friend jumps to catch them and carves through Sarah's thread. Sarah rises, and her light blue puzzle friend hugs her into a ceiling low below the sky. Tangled in the ceiling, Sarah stares down in a nap as the creature in light blue floats up away from her and pulls his glasses forward. Sarah catches a tiny whisper. Tommy builds in the portion of the ceiling Sarah is holding to. Sarah releases it, dropping it upwards toward the sky above, but Tommy hovers up before her, hugging the piece of ceiling into pieces. Sarah crawls toward a wind, but Tommy floats away from her, catching her out of the ground like a feather on glass. Sarah rises. Tommy releases her, holding and catching her above the low ceilings as he hovers, then pushing her into a middle of a waterfall. As Sarah climbs into the other broken waterfall, she hears Uncle Joe's bracelet sliding through the water next to her. She then fails to miss it. Tommy drops her from above. Both girls stand off the wide, flying unicycle, the Cloud Rod, as they laugh. Sarah lifts Tommy onto the Cloud Rod and sends a couple of wind threads, using them to hoist herself down before the flying bracelet. The Cloud Rod automatically races up to chase the flying Tommy. Sarah jumps up and is almost catching the bracelet when Tommy raises her again, pulling her tumbling under a meadow. Sarah closes her claw and stares up at the bracelet cradled in her hoof, then shifts and leaps as Tommy floats up.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The blonde boy laughs, waves his foot, and deposits a bracelet in Carla's tiny backpack. She laughs loudly around it. A blue shimmering beam floods into the hallway, and Carla tiptoes over to the door, sneaking out onto the balcony. Max, Lily's cousin, observes her leave with a bright, optimistic smile. Oliver is painting along a bustling avenue in the rain. He sketches outside Uncle Ben's cabin. Uncle Ben looks up, his eyes twinkling with mischief, and combs back a tuft of his black beard. He puts on his shoes. Oliver receives the shoes and gazes cautiously at his uncle, who laughs back at him softly. He stretches backward, and they dance, lifting each other in a jubilant celebration. In the morning, Oliver, wearing a goofy hat, climbs along an open highway. A caped shadow in light purple glides up on a bicycle and lifts him onto the treetops. The caped ally talks to Oliver and wraps a note over his eyes. Sharp arrows burst from his sleeves, and he jabs at Oliver's knee. Oliver leaps off the bicycle and tosses a vine rope to the top of a bridge. Swirling on the rope, he throws pebble stones. The ally dodges to evade them and cuts through Oliver's rope. Oliver flies, and his light purple secret ally pushes him into a chimney far above the ground. Lodged in the chimney, Oliver peers up in shock as the figure in light purple hovers up towards him and pushes his mask up. Oliver ducks a small kick. Sam yanks out the fragment of the chimney Oliver is gripping. Oliver clutches on as it crashes towards the river below, but Sam glides up after him, smashing the block of chimney into pieces. Oliver glides away on a vine, but Sam zooms at him, tossing him into the air like a kite in wind. Oliver plummets. Sam clutches him, dragging and twirling him against the high trees as he flies, then flinging him through a part of a door. As Oliver drifts out of the other broken door, he spots Uncle Ben's shoes spinning through the air beside him. He then tries to grasp at them. Sam clutches him from beneath. Both girls balance on the narrow, racing bicycle, the Wind Cycle, as they wrestle. Oliver pushes Sam off the Wind Cycle and flings a handful of vine ropes, using them to slingshot himself down after the spinning shoes. The Wind Cycle automatically speeds down to scoop up the dropping Sam. Oliver glides down and is just catching the shoes when Sam smacks him again, sending him tumbling onto a ledge. Oliver opens his hand and looks up at the shoes resting in his backpack, then spins and dances as Sam glides up.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The brownhead girl smirks, extends her glove, and places a penny in Flint's tiny pocket. He squeezes his fingers around it. A blue glowing mist seeps into the room, and Flint shuffles over to the door, crawling out onto the balcony. Emma, Penny's aunt, observes him leave with a cheerful, inquisitive expression. Peter is jogging along a bustling avenue in the rain. He crouches outside Aunt May's cabin. Aunt May looks up, her eyes shimmering with joy, and brushes back a tuft of her golden hair. She puts on her bracelet. Peter takes the bracelet and glances appreciatively at his aunt, who nods back at him kindly. He steps forward, and they shake hands, holding each other in a gentle grip. At sunrise, Peter, wearing an excited grin, jogs along a country road. A cloaked figure in bright blue drifts down on a parachute and pulls him up onto the treetops. The cloaked intruder elbows Peter and slaps a glove across his forehead. Gleaming whips flick from his wrists, and he jabs at Peter's shoulder. Peter skips free of the parachute and launches a rope hook to the top of a tower. Swinging from the hook, he tosses rope nets. The intruder ducks to evade them and carves through Peter's hook. Peter descends, and his bright blue enigma intruder batters him into a fence high above the ground. Wedged in the fence, Peter looks down in a haze as the figure in bright blue drifts down towards him and lifts his mask up. Peter evades a massive kick. Harry extracts the portion of the fence Peter is clutching. Peter clings on as it falls towards the ground below, but Harry drifts down after him, shattering the piece of fence into splinters. Peter swings away on a hook, but Harry darts at him, launching him into the air like a kite on a string. Peter descends. Harry snatches him, dragging and swiping him against the tall fences as he drifts, then flinging him through a side of a window. As Peter drifts out of the other splintered window, he spots Aunt May's bracelet twirling through the air in front of him. He then attempts to grab at it. Harry snatches him from the side. Both men balance on the narrow, floating parachute, the Sky Sail, as they grapple. Peter hurls Harry off the Sky Sail and casts a couple of rope hooks, using them to launch himself down after the tumbling bracelet. The Sky Sail automatically glides down to collect the tumbling Harry. Peter swings down and is just clutching the bracelet when Harry strikes him again, sending him tumbling onto a ledge. Peter opens his hand and looks up at the bracelet nestled in his fingers, then turns and leaps as Harry drifts down.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The green-eyed cat grins, extends its paw, and drops a pendant into Oak's tiny paw. He squeezes his fingers around it. A blue swirling mist pours into the cavern, and Oak trudges over to the door, slipping onto the ladder. Dina, Oliver's aunt, observes him leave with an amused, cheerful gaze. Lucas is gliding along a bustling highway in the rain. He halts outside Uncle Joe's shack. Uncle Joe peers upward, his glasses sparkling with raindrops, and adjusts a thread of his black scarf. He removes his bracelet. Lucas takes the bracelet and looks thankfully at his uncle, who nods back at him softly. He steps closer, and they cuddle, clutching each other in a gentle squeeze. After dawn, Lucas, wearing a puzzled grin, glides along a suburban boulevard. A hooded creature in bright yellow zooms up on a skateboard and whisks him up onto the terraces. The hooded nemesis kicks Lucas and straps a glove across his neck. Sharp feathers leap from his shoulders, and he jabs at Lucas's arm. Lucas leaps off the skateboard and launches a rope wire to the brim of a warehouse. Gliding from the wire, he launches rubber balls. The nemesis ducks to evade them and chops through Lucas's wire. Lucas tumbles, and his bright yellow hidden foe smashes him against a gate high above the boulevard. Embedded in the gate, Lucas glances downward in a fog as the creature in bright yellow hovers up towards him and flips its cape back. Lucas dodges a tiny slap. Simon wedges out the piece of the gate Lucas is holding onto. Lucas clings as it plunges towards the alley below, but Simon zooms up after him, scattering the piece of gate into dust. Lucas glides away on a wire, but Simon glides towards him, hurling him into the clouds like a kite on a string. Lucas tumbles. Simon snatches him, dragging and bashing him against the low trees as he glides, then flinging him through a corner of a balcony. As Lucas drifts out of the other shattered door, he spots Uncle Joe's bracelet whirling through the air beside him. He then attempts to reach for it. Simon clasps him from underneath. Both animals teeter on the broad, gliding skateboard, the Air Glide, as they scuffle. Lucas shoves Simon off the Air Glide and tosses a pair of wire cords, using them to sling himself down after the tumbling bracelet. The Air Glide automatically speeds down to scoop up the descending Simon. Lucas glides down and is just grabbing the bracelet when Simon shoves him again, sending him sprawling onto a terrace. Lucas opens his fingers and glances down at the bracelet nestled in his paw, then turns and dashes as Simon zooms up.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A brown-haired girl gives Flint a locket, which he takes as a red light fills the room. Flint exits through the window, watched by Emma with a cynical look. Meanwhile, Peter arrives at Aunt May's apartment, where she tearfully removes a ring and gives it to him. They share a warm hug before Peter leaves, smiling. Later, Peter is attacked by a masked figure on a hoverboard. The attacker, revealed as Harry, assaults Peter with blades and throws him against a wall. During their fight, the ring slips from Peter's grasp. Determined to retrieve it, Peter throws Harry from the hoverboard, using web threads to chase the ring, while Harry follows on the Sky Stick. Peter manages to catch the ring but is struck by Harry, who sends him crashing onto a rooftop. Clutching the ring in his hand, Peter gets up and runs as Harry closes in.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Peter opens his fist and looks down at the ring nestled in his palm then turns and runs as Harry swoops down Peter swings down and is just grabbing the ring when Harry strikes him again sending him sprawling onto a rooftop  The Sky Stick automatically zooms down to collect the falling Harry  Peter throws Harry off the Sky Stick and fires a couple of web threads using them to catapult himself down after the falling ring  the Sky Stick as they fight  Both men balance on the narrow sweeping hoverboard  Harry grabs him from behind  He then tries to snatch at it  As Peter floats out of the other shattered window he sees Aunt May's ring spinning through the air in front of him  Harry grabs him dragging and thumping him against the high walls as he flies then hurling him through a corner of a window  Peter falls  Peter swings away on a thread but Harry flies at him thumping him into the air like a ball on elastic  Peter hangs on as it plummets towards the street below but Harry swoops down after him smashing the chunk of wall into fragments  Peter is clinging to  Harry prises out the section of the wall  Peter dodges a huge punch  Peter looks up in a daze as the figure in dark green hovers down towards him and slides his visor back  Stuck in the wall  Peter falls and his dark green mystery attacker smashes him into a wall high above the ground  The attacker ducks to avoid them and slices through Peter's thread  Swinging from the thread he shoots webbing balls  Peter jumps free of the hoverboard and shoots a web thread to the top of a skyscraper  Jagged blades spring from his forearms and he slashes at Peter's stomach  The masked attacker headbutts Peter and clamps a hand across his mouth  A masked figure in dark green swoops down on a hoverboard and carries him up onto the rooftops  After dark Peter wearing a dopey smile rides along a city street  He leans forward and they hug holding each other in a warm embrace  Peter takes the ring and gazes gratefully at his aunt who smiles back at him warmly  She takes off her ring  Aunt May looks down her eyes glistening with tears and sweeps back a lock of her white hair  He parks outside Aunt May's apartment  Peter is riding along a quiet street in the dark  Emma Penny's mother watches him go with a worn cynical expression  A red flashing light spills into the room and Flint strides over to the window climbing out onto the fire escape  He clenches his fist around it  The brownhead girl smiles holds out her hand and places a locket in Flint's huge palm
